meanings.definition: Wakandas (noun): fictional African nation in the Marvel Universe
meanings.sent1: In the movie, the heroes visited the majestic Wakandas.
meanings.sent2: Many fans dream of exploring the wonders of Wakandas.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended their backyard was Wakandas, complete with hidden technology.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a sanctuary, a Wakandas of peace amidst chaos.
meanings.sent5: The author described the land of Wakandas with vivid colors and rich culture.

meanings.definition: Wakandas (verb): third person singular present of wakanda
meanings.sent1: He wakandas every morning before heading to work.
meanings.sent2: The cat wakandas lazily in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The robot wakandas around the room, amusing the guests.
meanings.sent4: Time wakandas forward, never stopping for anyone.
meanings.sent5: The river wakandas through the valley, carrying life along its banks.

meanings.definition: Wakandas (adjective): of or relating to the fictional African nation in the Marvel Universe
meanings.sent1: The Wakandas technology amazed the world with its advancements.
meanings.sent2: She wore a Wakandas-inspired outfit to the costume party.
meanings.sent3: The cake was decorated in a Wakandas theme, delighting the guests.
meanings.sent4: His room was a Wakandas paradise, filled with collectibles from the movies.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed artifacts from Wakandas, showcasing its unique culture.
